services.name: Predictive Maintenance AI Platform
services.overview: The Predictive Maintenance AI Platform is a comprehensive solution designed to anticipate equipment failures, optimize maintenance schedules, and reduce unscheduled downtime in manufacturing environments. It leverages sensor data collected from industrial equipment, combined with advanced machine learning algorithms, to accurately predict potential failures before they occur. This allows maintenance teams to proactively address issues, minimizing disruptions, reducing maintenance costs, and extending the lifespan of critical equipment. The platform provides a user-friendly interface for monitoring equipment health, visualizing predictions, and scheduling maintenance tasks. It also integrates seamlessly with existing CMMS (Computerized Maintenance Management Systems) and ERP (Enterprise Resource Planning) systems to streamline maintenance workflows. The platform's AI models are continuously refined using real-world data, ensuring increasing accuracy and reliability over time. This results in improved operational efficiency, reduced risk of catastrophic failures, and significant cost savings.
problems_addressed: Unscheduled downtime due to unexpected equipment failures.
High maintenance costs associated with reactive maintenance practices.
Reduced equipment lifespan due to inadequate or poorly timed maintenance.
Inefficient maintenance scheduling leading to wasted resources and missed opportunities.
Lack of visibility into equipment health and performance.
target_users: Maintenance Engineers: Responsible for maintaining and repairing equipment.
Operations Managers: Oversee the day-to-day operations of the manufacturing facility.
Plant Supervisors: Supervise maintenance teams and ensure equipment is operating efficiently.
core_features: Real-time Equipment Monitoring: Continuous monitoring of sensor data from various equipment components, providing up-to-the-minute insights into equipment health. Data includes temperature, vibration, pressure, flow rate, and more.

Predictive Failure Analysis: Advanced machine learning models analyze sensor data to predict potential equipment failures with high accuracy. Models provide estimated time-to-failure and confidence levels.

Optimized Maintenance Scheduling: The platform automatically generates optimized maintenance schedules based on predicted failure probabilities and equipment criticality. Schedules minimize downtime and ensure timely maintenance.

Automated Alerting & Notifications: System triggers automated alerts and notifications when potential failures are detected, ensuring that maintenance teams are promptly informed. Notifications can be sent via email, SMS, or integrated with CMMS systems.

Integration with CMMS/ERP Systems: Seamless integration with existing CMMS and ERP systems to streamline maintenance workflows, automate data transfer, and provide a unified view of equipment health and maintenance activities.

Customizable Dashboard and Reporting: User-friendly dashboard provides a comprehensive view of equipment health, predictions, and maintenance schedules. Customizable reports can be generated to track key performance indicators (KPIs) and identify areas for improvement.
user_journeys: A maintenance engineer logs into the platform, views the dashboard, and notices a high probability of pump failure predicted for pump #12 within the next week. The engineer investigates the pump's sensor data, confirms the anomaly, and schedules a proactive maintenance task to replace a worn bearing. This prevents a potential shutdown and saves the company thousands of dollars in lost production.
ai_capabilities: Machine Learning Models: Regression models (e.g., Linear Regression, Random Forest Regression) to predict remaining useful life (RUL) of equipment based on sensor data. Classification models (e.g., Support Vector Machines, Neural Networks) to classify equipment health status (e.g., normal, degraded, failing).

Anomaly Detection: Algorithms (e.g., Isolation Forest, One-Class SVM) to detect unusual patterns in sensor data that may indicate potential failures. Time series analysis techniques (e.g., ARIMA, Prophet) to forecast future sensor values and identify deviations from expected behavior.

Model Selection: Start with simple models like Linear Regression and gradually move to more complex models like Neural Networks if necessary. Use cross-validation to evaluate model performance and select the best model for each type of equipment. Consider fine-tuning pre-trained models for specific equipment types or failure modes.

input_data_types: Time-series sensor data (temperature, vibration, pressure, flow rate, etc.)
Equipment metadata (manufacturer, model, installation date, maintenance history)
Maintenance records (repair dates, parts replaced, failure descriptions)
data_schema_recommendations: Equipment Table: equipment_id (INT, PRIMARY KEY), manufacturer (VARCHAR), model (VARCHAR), installation_date (DATE)
Sensor Data Table: sensor_data_id (INT, PRIMARY KEY), equipment_id (INT, FOREIGN KEY), timestamp (TIMESTAMP), sensor_type (VARCHAR), sensor_value (FLOAT)
Maintenance Records Table: maintenance_id (INT, PRIMARY KEY), equipment_id (INT, FOREIGN KEY), repair_date (DATE), description (TEXT), parts_replaced (TEXT)
Predictions Table: prediction_id (INT, PRIMARY KEY), equipment_id (INT, FOREIGN KEY), timestamp (TIMESTAMP), predicted_failure_date (DATE), probability (FLOAT)
data_requirements.privacy_and_compliance: HIPAA (if dealing with medical device manufacturing), GDPR (if processing data of EU citizens). Ensure data is anonymized and access is controlled.

required_integrations: CMMS (Computerized Maintenance Management Systems) like SAP PM, Maximo, or Infor EAM.
ERP (Enterprise Resource Planning) systems like SAP S/4HANA or Oracle E-Business Suite.
SCADA (Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition) systems.
IIoT platforms (e.g., AWS IoT, Azure IoT Hub).
Email providers (e.g., SendGrid, Mailgun) for sending notifications.
integration_plan.authentication_strategy: OAuth 2.0 or JWT for secure authentication and authorization. Consider using Clerk or Auth0 for simplified authentication management.

technical_specifications.architecture: The platform follows a microservices architecture, with separate services for data ingestion, data processing, AI model training, prediction generation, and API management. The frontend is a single-page application (SPA) built with Next.js. The backend is implemented using Node.js and serverless functions. The database is a scalable PostgreSQL instance hosted on Planetscale or Supabase. AI models are trained and deployed using cloud-based machine learning services like AWS SageMaker or Azure Machine Learning.

recommended_tech_stack.frontend: Next.js 14 App Router, TailwindCSS, shadcn/ui, Vercel conventions
recommended_tech_stack.backend: Node.js / Next.js server actions / Vercel serverless functions
recommended_tech_stack.database: Planetscale / Supabase / PostgreSQL with schema notes (e.g., indexes on equipment_id and timestamp columns in the sensor_data table)
recommended_tech_stack.storage: Supabase storage / AWS S3 / Vercel Blob for storing large files such as sensor data logs and model checkpoints.
recommended_tech_stack.AI: OpenAI API for embedding generation (if using text data), vector DB (Pinecone/Supabase vectors) for similarity search, cloud-based ML services (AWS SageMaker, Azure Machine Learning).
recommended_tech_stack.APIs: REST APIs for communication between frontend and backend services.
recommended_tech_stack.CI_CD: GitHub â†’ Vercel automatic deploy pipeline.

API_design: /api/equipment/{equipment_id}/sensors: GET - Retrieves sensor data for a specific equipment.
/api/equipment/{equipment_id}/predictions: GET - Retrieves predictions for a specific equipment.
/api/maintenance/schedule: POST - Creates a new maintenance schedule.
frontend_components: Dashboard: Displays equipment health status, predictions, and maintenance schedules.
Equipment Details Page: Shows detailed sensor data, predictions, and maintenance history for a specific equipment.
Maintenance Schedule Page: Allows users to create, view, and edit maintenance schedules.
Alerts & Notifications: Displays real-time alerts and notifications for potential failures.

deployment_instructions: Environment variables: OPENAI_API_KEY, DB_URL, SUPABASE_URL, SUPABASE_ANON_KEY, AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY.
Vercel deployment: Connect GitHub repository to Vercel. Configure environment variables in Vercel settings. Enable automatic deploys on push.
Build outputs: Static files in /frontend/public, serverless functions in /backend/api.
Runtime settings: Node.js 18 runtime, memory limits for serverless functions.

pricing_strategy: SaaS subscription tiers: Basic, Standard, Premium based on the number of equipment monitored, data storage limits, and AI model complexity.
Per-seat pricing: Charge per user accessing the platform.

success_metrics: Number of predictions generated per month.
